messages.message: Currently with the converse APIs, we ~won't~ ~support~ are not supporting advanced tables and checkboxes.
@Jasper - is your customer looking for the API support via  Converse or to run a Build project (via Apps API)?

Thanks @Balaram, are we planning to support advanced tables from the build API? If yes, will that be the case from Oct 9?

Also, curious why we will not support advanced tables from converse APIs? The feature could be a great help for many Enterprise customers as well when used from refiner.
@Varun Jain I think they would be open to use the build API as an alternative. I can look into this if the results are as good as through the Converse API
@Jasper - this is just a case of sequencing and prioritization. we are planning to support this for converse APIs, but haven’t got to it yet. Which customer is interested to try this?

Got it, so we will support it at some point, we just haven't prioritised it. That makes sense.

It would be the below banking start-up. They are related to VR Smart Finanz (who is in contracting stage as a Enterprise customer).
https://www.vr-smart-guide.de

Sounds good. We have a request for this task - *DR-2609 Support long table with Converse API (https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/DR-2609?atlOrigin=eyJpIjoiMGZkY2JlZjRkNjg2NGRiOTliY2NjODFlYzAzMWRiMzQiLCJwIjoiamlyYS1zbGFjay1pbnQifQ)*

Let me know how critical it is for this customer, and we can prioritise accordingly.

@Mitch Welzen and @Ben Hope confirmed that they would want to make use of the advanced table feature for the delivery of the solution for VR Smart Finanz. So it would be great if we could prioritise this for 23.41? @Mitch Welzen feel free to weigh in yourself

Are we planning to use the Converse APIs via refiner, @Mitch Welzen? Can you share more details of the use case? It will help us make sure we understand the requirements.

cc: @Balaram @hannah

I’m curious why we are not planning to use the current way of using LLMs in refiner (e.g. latest updates here - https://instabase.slack.com/archives/CTZCW6N5U/p1694205614957439) , and instead use Converse APIs for this use case.

Is it primarily because of the support of long table extraction?

Yes, that's correct. For the Enterprise solution delivery of VR Smart Finanz we will use the current way of using LLMs from refiner - but it would be great to have advanced tables included there as well.

My initial request in this thread here was about the subsidiary company from VR Smart Finanz called VR Smart Guide. They want to get started with table extraction through the AI Hub Converse API. The urgency here is relatively lower though as they are not a focus customer of ours.

Sorry for the confusion.

No worries, thanks for clarifying. This will help us in prioritisation.

Why does VR Smart Guide prefer AI Hub Converse API, over using ibllm package via refiner? Are they more technical and want to build the solution themselves on AI Hub?

@Varun Jain What is important is that we are looking to resolve VRSM usecase with LLMs where possible
They will be buying the enterprise platform, and I don't believe they "the customer" minds how we resolve this challenge, as long as we do , and stick to there legal requirements, for example, no PII data to leave Europe

If you are saying we can get more accurate results on LARGE year reports IN GERMAN. What is critical is the tables which need to be pulled from these reports, they need to be working well

Being able to extract the tables correctly with LLMs will be the critical component of this deal, as long as this can be achieve, I don't believe it matters much which LLM is used, (considering the legal requirements above)

cc @Ben Hope
@Mitch Welzen Can you share a redacted sample to understand what type of reports and tables we have in scope?
@Jasper might be able to help here, this is still pre sales

EDIT: Removed link to avoid the samples going outside of this project scope. Varun and Mitch have access. Let me know if you also need access.
~Please find redacted samples here on this link Look at the PDFs Called DB_1.pdf through DB_30.pdf. Please do not use the files outside of the analysis for this project~
